page.title: 05 ECONOMICS OF THE AREA
page.content: There are 3 banks in Maud,The Royal Bank of Scotland,The Trustees Savings Bank and The Clydesdale Bank. The Royal Bank opened in 1913.It has over 700 accounts held by farmers, businessmen,solicitors,tradesmen,shopk eepers and factory workers,retired people and housewives.Four people work there.Each week between two and three hundred people use the counter services.The TSB opened in the 1920's Local residents are the regular customers.Approximately 70 customers per week use the bank and two people work there.There are 95% personal to 5% business clients. Many accounts can be paid at the bank:Gas, Electricity,Telephone and Mail Order Companies.Money can be transferred to accounts of other people at other banks. Five people work in the Clydesdale Bank.
